title: Green Line D Track and Signal Replacement
text: The project will replace approximately 6.5 miles of signal infrastructure and 25,000 feet of track between Beaconsfield and Riverside.

title: Better Bus Project
image_alt: Better Bus Project: Making transit better together
text: In cooperation with the communities served by MBTA bus routes, the current bus network will be compared to the Service Delivery Policy to identify and fill service gaps.

title: New Red and Orange Line Vehicles
text: The Red and Orange Line fleets will be entirely replaced by 2022 for safer, more efficient service.

title: Quincy Center Station Improvements
text: The Quincy Center Garage will undergo a number of repairs to improve accessibility and safety.

title: Wollaston Station Improvements
image_alt: Red Line train departing from Wollaston Station during the day
text: Wollaston Station will be completely renovated to become an accessible, modern, code-compliant station.

title: Newton Highlands Station Accessibility Improvements
image_alt: Rendering of a new ramp from Walnut Street
text: The project includes installation of 3 new ramps and level boarding platforms with tactile edges.

title: Fenway Portal Project
image_alt: A Green Line train passes through the Fenway Portal.
text: Large steel doors will be installed at the entrance to the Green Line tunnel to protect the subway from potential future flooding.

title: Commuter Rail Positive Train Control (PTC)
image_alt: Commuter rail train at a station platform.
text: Positive Train Control (PTC) technology will improve safety and reduce human error on the Commuter Rail. It is a federally mandated system that can automatically reduce train speeds or even stop a train to avoid a collision or derailment.

title: Bus Transit Priority
image_alt: Bus traveling on a bus priority lane in Arlington
text: The T is partnering with communities to explore and implement tools such as bus lanes, queue jumps, and transit signal priority to improve bus reliability and service.

title: Rail Vision
image_alt: Logo with "Rail Vision" in purple and a grid layout between the two words
text: The Rail Vision study's results will identify the most cost-effective strategy for leveraging the MBTA's rail network to meet new trends in travel and address the economic growth needs of the Greater Boston region.
